content.question: Freshwater bony fish secrete large volumes of very dilute urine. Many marine bony fish secrete small volumes of concentrated urine. Which of the following best explains the differences in nitrogenous-waste excretion between freshwater and marine bony fish?

choices.label: The differences arose during divergence, as fish from a common ancestor faced different selective pressures in environments of different osmolarity.
The differences resulted from the evolution of kidneys in independent evolutionary lineages that were adapted to different environmental conditions.
The differences are accidents of evolutionary divergence and are unrelated to the osmotic differences in freshwater and marine environments.
The differences arise in each generation because of the physiological adjustment of individual fish to fluctuating salt concentrations in the environments in which they live.

content.answer: The differences arose during divergence, as fish from a common ancestor faced different selective pressures in environments of different osmolarity.
